pkgmetadata.longdescription: # CDKTF Local Exec ConstructA simple construct that executes a command locally. This is useful to run build steps within your CDKTF Program or to run a post action after a resource is created.The construct uses the null provider to achieve this so it can be trusted to only run after all dependencies are met.## Usage```pythonimport { Provider, LocalExec } from "cdktf-local-exec";// LocalExec extends from the null provider,// so if you already have the provider initialized you can skip this stepnew Provider(this, "local-exec");const frontend = new LocalExec(this, "frontend-build", { // Will copy this into an asset directory cwd: "/path/to/project/frontend", command: "npm install && npm build",});const pathToUpload = `${frontend.path}/dist`;new LocalExec(this, "frontend-upload", { cwd: pathToUpload, command: `aws s3 cp --recursive ${pathToUpload} s3://${bucket.name}/frontend`,});new LocalExec(this, "backend-build", { cwd: "/path/to/project/backend", copyBeforeRun: false, // can not run remotely since the runner has no docker access command: "docker build -t foo . && docker push foo",});```### Options* `cwd`: The working directory to run the command in. It will be copied before execution to ensure the asset can be used in a remote execution environment.* `command`: The command to execute.* `copyBeforeRun`: If true, the command will copy the `cwd` directory into a tmp dir and run there. If false, the command will be executed in the `cwd` directory.
